name: misdirection
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of sending something to the wrong place or aiming something in the wrong direction: If you press the Send button too soon there is the possibility of mistakes and misdirection.
the action of using something in a way that is not suitable or right: the misdirection of financial resources I think this campaign is a misdirection of energy. There are lot of other issues that are more important right now.
the action of making people pay attention to the wrong thing, usually intentionally so that they will not notice something else: Many investigators suspect the language in the letter is purposeful misdirection. the magician's trick of misdirection
More examplesFewer examplesWe will look at any complaints where there has been a misdirection or a delay in transfers of money. There is a risk with spinal acupuncture of the misdirection of needles.We are not going to accept the misdirection of education resources.Our lives are full of aimlessness, misdirection of energy and pointless goals.This is the politics of misdirection, keeping the opponent on the defensive by raising spurious questions about his "character."The director never loses his talent for misdirection; the baddies leave a trail of red herrings.
